7+ years of hands-on experience with: field research, ethnography, lab-based user testing, remote testing, paper prototype testing, iterative prototype testing, concept testing, and survey design
BS in HCDE, Human Factors, Cognitive Psychology, or similar experience.

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
Amazon’s eCommerce Foundation (eCF) organization is responsible for the core components that drive the Amazon website and customer experience. Serving millions of customer page views and orders per day, eCF builds for scale. As an organization within eCF, the Big Data Technologies (BDT) group is no exception. We collect petabytes of data from thousands of data sources inside and outside Amazon including the Amazon catalog system, inventory system, customer order system, page views on the website and Alexa systems. We also support Amazon subsidiaries such as IMDB and Audible. We provide interfaces for our internal customers to access and query the data hundreds of thousands of times per day, using Amazon Web Service’s (AWS) Redshift, Hive, Spark and Oracle. We build scalable solutions that grow with the Amazon business.

BDT is growing, and the data processing landscape is shifting. Our data is consumed by thousands of teams across Amazon including Research Scientists, Machine Learning Specialists, Business Analysts and Data Engineers. BDT team is building an enterprise-wide Big Data Marketplace leveraging AWS technologies. We enable teams at Amazon to produce analytical data in any form of storage (S3, DynamoDB, Aurora, etc.) and process that data using any type of compute environment such as EMR/Spark, Redshift, Athena, and others via a common bus. We are developing innovative products including the next-generation of data catalog, data discovery engine, data transformation platform, and more with state-of-the-art user experience. We’re looking for top engineers to build them from the ground up.

This is a hands-on position where you will do everything from designing and building extremely scalable components and cutting-edge features to formulating strategy and direction for Big Data at Amazon. You will also mentor junior engineers and work with the most sophisticated customers in the business to help them get the best results. You need to not only be a top software developer with excellent programming skills, an understanding of big data and parallelization, and a stellar record of delivery, but also excel at leadership and customer obsession and have a real passion for massive-scale computing.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Keeping your finger on the pulse of the constantly evolving and growing Big Data field
- Translation of complex functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design
- Delivering systems and features with top-notch quality, on time
- Stay current on technical knowledge to keep pace with rapidly changing technology, and work with the team in bringing new technologies on board

Come help us build for the future of Big Data!


By submitting your application here, you can apply once to be considered for multiple Software Engineer openings across various Amazon teams. If you are successful in passing through the initial application review and assessment, you will be asked to submit your career and personal preferences so that our dedicated recruiters can match you to the right role based on these preferences.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
AWS EC2 core platform team is looking for a software development engineer like you to work on the very heart of EC2. Our team has a vision of consolidating best practices in one place. We are changing the way EC2 build services and we would love for you to learn, contribute and have resounding impact.

As a member of the EC2 team, your responsibilities would include:
· Working with team members to manage the day-to-day development activities, participate in designs, design review, code review, and implementation.
· Engaging and working with customers and dependencies to ensure quality delivery.
· Mentoring other engineers.
· Maintaining current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology, aspiring to look out for new technologies and work with the team in bringing in new technologies.

Mentorship and Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new team members. Our team has a broad mix of experience levels and Amazon tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior engineers truly enjoy mentoring more junior engineers and engineers from non-traditional backgrounds through one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth. We try to assign projects and tasks based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive Team Culture

Our team is intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Yes we do get to build a really cool service, but we also think a big reason for that is the inclusive and welcoming culture we try to cultivate every day. We’re looking for a new teammate who is enthusiastic, empathetic, curious, motivated, reliable, and able to work effectively with a diverse team of peers. Someone who will
help us amplify the positive and inclusive team culture we’ve been building.

On-Call Responsibility

This position involves on-call responsibilities, typically for one week every two months. We don’t like getting paged in the middle of the night or on the weekend, so we work to ensure that our systems are fault tolerant. When we do get paged, we work together to resolve the root cause so that we don’t get paged for the same issue twice.


In joining our team, you'll enjoy a competitive salary, great benefits, a creative and comfortable work environment, and the exciting opportunity to be part of a fast-paced and growing technology company.

For more information on Amazon Web Services please visit: http://aws.amazon.com or email seattletechjobs@amazon.com

title: Senior Solutions Architect, AWS Partners
description:
At Amazon Web Services (AWS) we are inventing the future of cloud computing with a team of builders who try new things and dream big dreams. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in the cloud used by hundreds of thousands of developers, governments and businesses around the world. It is still Day 1 for us, and we are looking for curious people to be part of our diverse teams of thinkers, testers, and doers.

Our Solutions Architects team is seeking candidates passionate about using technology to solve business problems with big customer impact. As a Solutions Architect on our team, you will support AWS Partners and drive thought leadership to our Government, Educational, HealthCare and Non-Profit Institutions working closely with a world-class sales and business development team. You will be able to learn from, collaborate with, and educate some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Roles and Responsibilities:

· As a Solutions Architect, you will work directly with AWS Partners to accelerate their projects and recommend best-practice architectures in line with their long-term business outcomes.
· You will own the technical relationship with the AWS Partner and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the AWS Partner will shape the guidance you provide.
· Share the voice of the AWS Partner to influence the roadmap of new features and services for the AWS platform.
· Create and capture best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
· Evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
· Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organization by hiring, coaching and mentoring others.
· Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's and partner's outcomes.

title: Senior Program Manager
description:
The Contentand App Partner Engagement in Japan is part of the Amazon Devices organization that is best known for our Fire TV, Fire Tablets, Echo, Alexa, and more. Our business connects consumers to the apps and games they love on these devices through our app store and related products. We also support the developers of these apps and games with the mobile commerce services that power unique experiences in their content. Our business in Japan represents one of our largest international marketplaces. Our team is responsible for all in-market activities including Business Development, Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Operations.

Our business is looking for a Sr. Operations/Program Manager based in our Tokyo, Japan office who enjoys being independent and hands on to learn and execute across a variety of manual activities such as content testing, language QA, contract approvals, issue tracking, and third-party vendor management. This is not a role for someone who likes to specialize. You are someone who is dedicated to the art of continuous improvement in everything you touch. You do this by learning how to execute a wide range of tasks, perform those tasks with a high degree of confidence, uncover ways to make them more efficient, and then teach others to do the same. You will be working across interconnected internal and vendor systems many of which sit outside of our direct business control, often in other countries. You will deeply understand how these systems and processes work, regardless of organization boundary, in order to deliver results before helping other people in the team do the same better, faster, or cheaper. A successful candidate will thrive in a high expectation culture and embrace ambiguity with critical, analytical thinking.

Key Responsibilities include:
· Take ownership of our developer facing support processes (content testing, contract management, issue tracking) as well other internal project management processes (key project status, communications cadence, business calendar)
· Be hands on and willing to directly execute our most critical processes which require high judgement and attention to detail
· Be an expert in the use of operating metrics and KPIs; recognize and deliver on opportunities for continuous improvement
· Anticipate bottlenecks, prioritize, provide escalation management, anticipate, and make trade-offs, and balance the business needs
· Communicate issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner and engage project stakeholders
· Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration, and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing priorities
· Work closely with our international business teams in Europe and the US, as well as our engineering resources in India

- 3+ years of experience working in a high-tech software or services organization

title: Sr. Product Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced, entrepreneurial, and technically adept leader for a confidential new initiative within Alexa.

Amazon’s Alexa cloud service and Echo devices are used every day, by people you know, in and about their homes. This customer facing program will help them get the most from their Alexa enabled devices.

As a Product Manager for Alexa, you will have an enormous opportunity to impact the customer experience, design, architecture, and implementation of cutting-edge products and services. You will drive product strategy and definition, and collaborate with engineering to develop and launch features.

The ideal candidate has a solid understanding of the software development process, a demonstrated track record of delivering new features and products, and passion for innovating on behalf of customers. They don’t need to have expertise in NLU (natural language understanding), or machine learning but should have curiosity about it. They value collaboration, data-driven decision making, learning, and can comfortably communicate with others, in both technical and non-technical roles.

Key Responsibilities:
· Lead the development of the product strategy and vision
· Create buy-in for the product vision across the Alexa organization and external parties.
· Establish metrics and key performance indicators for success
· Develop detailed business requirements, user stories, and product specifications
· Create product roadmaps that span multiple engineering teams across a large organization
· Work closely with multiple engineering teams to deliver

title: Procurement Operations Analyst
description:
At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.

As a Procurement Operations Analyst for the Amazon Fulfillment Center team, you will own the site’s indirect procurement operation responsibilities, including forecasting, inventory management, purchase order management and Vendor management of 3rd party service providers. You will lead supplier management KPI and metrics reporting, and work with stakeholders to find and understand deviation and improvement areas. You will provide procurement leadership and align with the building leadership team to drive efficiencies and improvements at the site(s).

This position requires a January 2020 start date.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
· In partnership with the Procurement Operations Manager, provide procurement operations support for the fulfillment center, including: forecasting of non-inventory products, inventory management, non-inventory flow and space models, cycle counts, supplier management, procurement transaction and expediting support
· Lead team of non-inventory receivers to ensure building has adequate resources and is set up for success
· Develop deep knowledge of non-inventory items and align with like buildings to drive best practices
· Manage KPI to measure, control and benchmark procurement processes including creation of recurring metrics reports to drive improvements for the Operations network
· Develop relationship across the building and network to ensure best practices are being shared and implemented
· Align with internal customers, Finance and Procurement Operations to understand budgetary targets by building and develop methods of measuring and defining savings, value and other category metrics
· Using input from the category team, build the category metrics model to track and monitor performance in relationship to the category strategy
· Measure actual vs planned savings; as savings trends are identified, own action plans to meet goals and develop solutions
· Work in partnership both internally and with suppliers to develop innovative solutions to provide Procurement support to the Operations network
· Develop and implement ways to measure suppliers to drive continuous performance improvement on behalf of Amazon
· Coordinate the demand identification, procurement, and inventory management of all non-merchandise items required for building operation. This includes corrugate, packing materials, labor and janitorial services, etc.
· Partner with Category team to manage and maintain supplier scorecards
. Partner with AP, Suppliers and various internal teams to ensure timely resolution of vendor payment issues
· Support the procurement operations and category management teams
· Work is done in a warehouse environment that requires frequent walking around the building. You should feel comfortable working in an environment with varying temperatures as many buildings have dock doors that open throughout shifts.

Supplier/ vendor relationship management experience

title: Software Development Manager, International Expansion
description:
Audible's International Expansion team is delivering on a vision for launching a localized, customer-centric presence in new countries, new product lines for audible, while building world class engineering platform to enable faster and differentiated launches. We are expanding and improving the platform from mobile web to back-end services while innovating and leveraging new Amazon technology and platforms. Success means we are delighting more customers in new countries, new product line ups while building on an already tremendously successful and much-loved product.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

· Own the complete software development lifecycle: defining, prioritizing, designing, and leading implementation and testing of new features within an Agile environment.
· Define, manage and improve the software and product development processes by working closely with high-performance engineers.
· Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team and ensure project plans and delivery commitments are met.
· Coach and mentor our high-performing architects and engineers to help them grow their skills, enhance their knowledge of our systems and their ability to get things done, while enabling them to be future leaders who are focused on building a high growth and inclusive culture.
· Architect and develop the innovative technical design and implementation approach with the overall product line goals and objectives in mind.
· Own team’s operational excellence, including creation of and monitoring of metrics and alarms in a continuous process improvement environment.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Amazon is focused on protecting the health and safety of our employees while continuing to serve people who need our services more than ever. Regular testing on a global scale across all industries would both help keep people safe and help get the economy back up and running. But, for this to work, we as a society would need vastly more testing capacity than is currently available. Unfortunately, today we live in a world of scarcity where COVID-19 testing is heavily rationed.

To help solve this problem, Amazon has begun the work of building incremental testing capacity and conducting research and development to apply cutting-edge technology advances to solve real world problems. We are seeking a Senior UX Designer (full-stack) to help define these novel approaches and execute against scaling them. You will work with a unique and gifted team developing exciting products in the Molecular Biology field for consumers and collaborate with cross-functional teams. Our team rewards intellectual curiosity while maintaining a laser-focus in bringing products to market. Competitive candidates are responsive, flexible, and able to succeed within an open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, startup-like environment. At the cutting edge of both academic and applied research in this area, you have the opportunity to work together with some of the most talented scientists, engineers, and product managers. Success in this role requires strong customer focus and skills at breaking down complex interactions between hardware and software and ability to synthesize complex information into common sense UIs both for physical and digital experiences.

Collaboration with stakeholders is integral to your process. Your work informs partners including product and programs managers, other UX designers and engineers.

Responsibilities
· Create interactions with LIMS system and end-user information UIs that make validating results simple while distilling complex information
· Create interactions and information architecture for connected hardware and accompanying applications.
· Brainstorm and prototype concepts, specify designs according to use cases and iterate designs based on feedback and data.
· Collaborate closely with a multi-disciplinary team to create user experiences that combine instrument interactions with the visual elements and animations.
· Contribute to Product Management and Engineering work streams to instill best practices in user interaction and service design throughout the customer’s journey.
· Be an advocate of customers throughout design and development of products.
· Ability to meet ambitious deadlines and deliver high-quality work on schedule.
basicQualifications: Bachelor’s or equivalent degree, in UX Design, HCI or related field, or equivalent professional experience in the design field.
5+ years of experience as a UX designer in interaction and
An online portfolio that demonstrates experience in creating concepts and detailing consumer journey, specifying interaction for hardware, web and digital services.
Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
Excellent speaking-listening-writing skills, attention to details, proactive self-starter
Ability to develop new ideas and creative solutions
preferredQualifications: Experience in working directly with engineers and leading complex discussions in UX design.
Experience working with diagnostics lab interfaces and automation instrumentation; tools/methodologies that are commonly used in modern labs
self-motivated with the capacity to work under pressure and deliver high-caliber products under tight deadlines
Proven track record of delivering results in large, cross-function initiatives
Proficiency hardware and web app UX design tool

Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
Understanding of information architecture, ability to use design methods to generate ideas and galvanize point-of-view with stakeholders, demonstration of UX and visual design sensibilities.
Strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and meet tight deadlines.
Strong problem solver: comfortable in addressing unknowns in user experience, product experience, and market best practices.

title: Software Development Engineer II
description:
The Amazon Modeling and Optimization Team (MOP) lowers the cost of operations and delivery and expedites the delivery experience for the Amazon customers through research and development for optimization, predictive modeling and machine learning algorithms. Software Engineers in MOP own the productization of the algorithms - the platform, infrastructure, data stores, data visualization, and both back-end as well as front-end code of the tools.

As a technology team, we are not tied to one technology – instead, we use what is best suited for the purpose. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies and really push the technical envelope. You’ll work to expand Amazon beyond market expectations via innovation and technical exploration through iterative development which includes project scoping / development that emphasizes software excellence. All of our systems tend to be loosely coupled, communicating using synchronous and asynchronous messaging, leading to a classic distributed processing architecture. We are looking for talented SDEs who enjoy working on creative algorithms, building large scale systems and who thrive in a fast-paced, fun environment.

1+ years professional experience in software development
Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as C++, Java, or Python
Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design
Experience with distributed systems, algorithm design, and relational databases
preferredQualifications: Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.
Experience in modern web development with HTML5, CSS3.0, and Javascript frameworks (AngularJS, React, etc.)

Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

title: Sr. Technical Program Manager
description:
Are you inspired by working on a ground-floor opportunity to reshape how customers will interact with Alexa? Do you dream of being at the forefront of AI and ML technologies, and shaping the future of human-machine interaction? Would you enjoy working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, start-up like environment? If you answered yes to any of these then consider Alexa AI team.

The Alexa AI team is looking for a customer focused Principal Technical Program Manager to help build, ship, and scale new Alexa capabilities that will reshape how customers will interact with Alexa across different modalities. This exceptional role requires an individual with a track record of shipping services/devices, experience working with science, product and engineering teams, experience working with multiple geographically distributed partner teams, and stellar leadership skills to rally teams around a common goal. The successful candidate will possess a strong program management background, have a passion for innovating, have a well-rounded technical background in current software and/or hardware disciplines, be comfortable with ambiguity and be motivated by a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives, but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in, and get the job done.

We are looking for a strong technical, customer-focused Principal Technical Program Manager with skills that span research science, software engineering, product management and sheer vision.

In this role you will:
· Engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary staff to drive innovative Alexa capabilities.
· Drive technical requirements, design, and delivery planning, working across engineering and science teams, and stakeholders to ensure successful launch of new initiatives.
· Work with a focused team of engineers, PEs and research scientists to build the platform that enables new products and features on Alexa.
· Find opportunities to apply innovation across different customers, driving technology advances in core platforms.
· Influence roadmap priorities, features, and engineering process working across multiple Alexa teams.
· Define program requirements and help engineering and science teams meet goals, accelerating progress by driving timely decisions, clearing blockers, and making trade-offs.
· Work with remote teams to deliver supporting software and services in sync with launch timelines
· Communicate regularly with senior management on status, risks and change control

title: Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect for Media and Entertainment (MandE)
description:
Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help Media and Entertainment (MandE) customers leverage the Amazon Web Services (AWS) platform to bring digital transformation for their video and content workloads in the cloud? Do you like to work on a variety of cloud services, building and implementing solutions on top of the AWS platform?

The Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect for MandE will be responsible helping customers accelerate their own success in the AWS Cloud. This builder position will join the Professional Services delivery team focused on AWS’ most critical video, content and media customer requirements. This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon’s world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies.

As a trusted customer advocate, you will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mindshare and broad use of AWS with the biggest customers in the Media and Entertainment industry. You will also need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other teams within AWS such as services teams, marketing, and business development as well as representing your team to executive management.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Work with existing and potential customers to deeply understand their business and technical needs. Develop solutions that make the best use of the AWS Cloud platform for video, content and media workloads.
· Interact with our customers to ensure design, integration, quality, and deployment expectations are met / exceeded; work closely with AWS pre-sales technical teams, to ensure solutions are well-architected and can be successfully delivered.
· Act as technical liaison between customers and the service engineering teams, providing product improvement feedback to AWS developers and accelerating the adoption of new features in customer deployments.
· Coordinate and lead internal solution design review processes.
· Publish and present solutions in large forums of peers and customers.
· Act as a technical liaison with third-party vendors to understand integration requirements and implement custom solutions.
· This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Experience communicating across internal and external organizations
AWS Solution Architecture certification or relevant cloud expertise
Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS

Ability to present with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
“Alexa, find me a job where I can create and innovate.” Yes, Alexa can make your wishes come true!

On the Alexa Voice Service team, you’ll build software to enable Alexa’s capabilities everywhere – in speakers, appliances, wearables, robots, and more! We’re working with industry leaders to seamlessly integrate Alexa into any and all devices. It’s awesome, and will change the way millions of people interact with their homes, cars and even their workplace.

If you’re passionate about greenfield engineering opportunities and love to solve problems that have never been encountered before – this is the job for you. If you have an insatiable thirst to learn – you’ll absolutely love this job. Imagine working together with other teams to architect solutions that define how customers interact with Alexa. You’ll own your work from design to deployment, evangelize it and ensure its operational excellence in production.

Become a builder, an innovator, and game changer by joining the AVS team. Let’s build something special, and have a ton of fun doing it!

As a member of the team, you will:
· Produce bullet-proof code that is robust, efficient and maintainable; our primary language is Java
· Empower companies and developers from around the world to embed Alexa into their devices and products
· Participate in setting the technical vision for Alexa Voice Service in alignment with our Product team
· Drive and lead software design, development standards, team processes and code reviews
· Design and implement features for new products, features, APIs, platforms and frameworks
· Mentor junior team members, help to maintain appropriate unit test coverage, code documentation and software structure
· Distill and communicate technical concepts to stakeholders

title: Software Development Manager, AWS Messaging
description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world leader in providing a highly available, durable, and secure infrastructure platform in the cloud, powering hundreds of thousands of businesses around the world. The AWS Messaging team owns and operates Amazon SNS (Simple Notification Service), Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service), and Amazon MQ. Our services provide AWS customers with the cloud messaging infrastructure needed for building highly scalable, asynchronous, and fault-tolerant applications.

We're looking for an SDM with an owner mindset, bias for action, and ability to dive deep and deliver results. You will lead a team of world-class engineers, be an operational champion, and deliver features to customers around the globe. You will drive our development process, and be a key influencer in our product roadmap.

title: Content Supply Chain Consultant
description:
Our MandE Principal Industry Specialist (IS) Consultants are focused on designing and delivering customer outcomes across complex media workloads for our MandE clients using AWS cloud services. They deliver cloud solution guidance, support POC’s (Proof-of-Concepts), lead assessments and discovery projects, develop thought leadership and represent AWS at leadership events and summits.

We are actively looking for a principal candidate to join our IS team who has deep experience in designing, operating, and transforming content supply chains in the MandE Industry. The candidate should have extensive experience in the workflows and related technologies used to create, manage, and deliver content, from the point of ideation to delivery of finished media content to one or more distribution end points. The workflows include Content Processing, Workflow Orchestration, Content Preparation (Encoding/Transcoding/Packaging), Rights Management, Archive and Asset Management, and Meta-data Management. Ideally, the candidate has direct experience with one or more media types across Episodic, News, Sports, Theatrical, VOD.

The position requires a blend of four (4) major skills which are a strong business acumen, deep MandE functional experience, strategic vision, and an innovative/builder mindset.

AWS Content Supply Chain Consultants:

-Collaborate directly with global MandE customers and partners addressing workflow performance, cloud workloads, security, compliance, scale, availability and manageability.

-Provide leadership to customers looking for solutions to transform their existing media workloads using Cloud technology.

-Act as the voice-of-the-customer to oversee engagements and assist with non-technical change management work on policies, procedures, operations and people.

-Acquire new technology skills and serve as trusted advisors for internal and external customers including global MandE customer architects and IT leaders

-Work across multiple AWS engineering teams introducing and refining new platforms, solutions and web based services for MandE conglomerates, major studios, music labels, OTT streaming services, new media companies, live events companies, location based entertainment, production and postproduction companies.

-Collect, package and publish best practices and repeatable offerings inclusive of AWS Partners to accelerate our customer’s transition to cloud based AWS services.

Responsibilities Include:

Customer Engagements – In collaboration with our go to market team, engage customers to envision end state solutions built on AWS. The solutions stars with end state business outcomes in mind, then working backwards with how AWS based technology enables those outcomes..

Industry Leadership- Lead AWS architecture discussions, cloud operations optimization, AWS migrations, security and integration of AWS services supporting global MandE customer requirements.

Support Sales Teams - Support on-site client projects proving the value of AWS products, services and support moving to new distributed cloud environments.

Technology Leadership – Define and design solutions that exceed customer expectations based on the use of AWS services and partners. Services include Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3), AI Services (LEX, REKognition), AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), AWS Media Services.

Develop Partnerships – Develop MandE industry solution roadmaps for clients, partners and service providers. Drive collaboration and integration between multiple partners to deliver comprehensive solutions for large MandE industry clients.

Industry Expertise Transfer –Work with global AWS professional services leadership to grow the AWS Professional Services (ProServe) Practice. Work with ProServe leadership to stay-ahead of the leading-edge platform services and be able to deploy quickly. Support best practices efforts for all AWS and Partners.

Customer Advocacy - Work with AWS engineering groups, technology and professional services teams conveying customer requirements, driving inputs into short-term and long-term AWS technology roadmaps.

Deliver Value - Support delivery of key MandE professional services engagements with clients and partners in feature film, feature animation, broadcast, OTT streaming, production, post production, music, live events, location based entertainment and visual effects (VFX) industries.

Industry Shows and Organizations – Support key industry trade shows, session panels, keynotes, industry groups, technology organizations and technology standards board’s directly conveying AWS corporate messaging and driving new industry wide engagements as necessary.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Customer Requirements- Understand customer requirements, project scope, and support SOW creation for relevant work.

MandE Partners- Work with relevant MandE partners to help lift-and-shift or re-engineer the existing solutions for AWS as appropriate based on customer’s project requirements.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.
basicQualifications: -Hands-on experience in at least one major MandE segment (Theatrical, Animation, TV/Episodic, Direct-to-Consumer, Sports, News and Publishing) with the ability to architect a solution that crosses segment boundaries i.e., glass-to-glass ecosystems for customers.
-Knowledge of common media frameworks, pipelines, and MandE industry software
-Experience building content production pipelines

-10+ years of experience in end-to-end media solutions incorporating media acquisition, non-linear editing, OTT streaming, digital supply chain management, distribution / content delivery, media processing / transcoding, media analytics and related technologies.

-Outstanding MandE industry customer C-level relationships, management experience and collaboration skills. Demonstrated ability to think strategically about MandE solutions, global workflows, cloud workloads, business strategy, products and emerging technology trends.

-Deep expertise delivering MandE technology solutions to major global MandE conglomerates through solution scoping, selling and delivery of consulting services, enabling emerging technologies and cloud based services.
preferredQualifications: -Understanding of AWS Services such as AWS Elemental Media Services, Elastic Transcoder, CloudFront, EC2, S3, Glacier is a plus.

-Thought leadership experience on relevant topics related to MandE cloud-based enterprises, solutions, platforms, workflows, production, post production, storage, DAM, MAM, innovation and IT infrastructure.
-MandE Vertical industry sales and delivery experience using industry standard technologies as well as leading-edge technology services and solutions.
-Experience with the design of modern, scalable delivery solutions for technology consulting services.
-Use of AWS services in distributed environments with Key AWS MandE industry cloud ecosystem partners.
-Advanced degrees in engineering and/or computer science.
-Advanced business degree is a plus.

title: Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect for Media and Entertainment (MandE)
description:
Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help Media and Entertainment (MandE) customers leverage the Amazon Web Services (AWS) platform to bring digital transformation for their video and content workloads in the cloud? Do you like to work on a variety of cloud services, building and implementing solutions on top of the AWS platform?

The Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect for MandE will be responsible helping customers accelerate their own success in the AWS Cloud. This builder position will join the Professional Services delivery team focused on AWS’ most critical video, content and media customer requirements. This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon’s world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies.

As a trusted customer advocate, you will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mindshare and broad use of AWS with the biggest customers in the Media and Entertainment industry. You will also need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other teams within AWS such as services teams, marketing, and business development as well as representing your team to executive management.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Work with existing and potential customers to deeply understand their business and technical needs. Develop solutions that make the best use of the AWS Cloud platform for video, content and media workloads.
· Interact with our customers to ensure design, integration, quality, and deployment expectations are met / exceeded; work closely with AWS pre-sales technical teams, to ensure solutions are well-architected and can be successfully delivered.
· Act as technical liaison between customers and the service engineering teams, providing product improvement feedback to AWS developers and accelerating the adoption of new features in customer deployments.
· Coordinate and lead internal solution design review processes.
· Publish and present solutions in large forums of peers and customers.
· Act as a technical liaison with third-party vendors to understand integration requirements and implement custom solutions.
· This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

title: Launch Engineer
description:
Job Description

The Team: Amazon Go is a new kind of store with no lines and no checkout. You simply use the Amazon Go app to enter the store, take what you want from our selection of fresh, delicious meals and grocery essentials, and go. Our checkout-free shopping experience is made possible by our Just Walk Out Technology. It automatically detects when products are taken from or returned to the shelves and keeps track of them in a virtual cart. When you’re done shopping, you just leave the store. Shortly after, we’ll charge your Amazon account and send you a receipt. Check it out at amazon.com/go. Designed and custom-built by Amazonians, our technology uses computer vision, sensor fusion, and advanced machine learning. Innovation is part of our DNA. We’re looking for people who want to join an ambitious team that continues to push the state of the art in computer vision, machine learning, distributed systems and hardware design. Additionally our team supports other Amazon Retail locations including Amazon Bookstores, Amazon 4-Star Stores, Popup Kiosks, and labs.


In this role you’ll have the opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a game-changing initiative. You’ll be working on challenging problems that need creative solutions. You should be comfortable building process, challenging assumptions, and thinking of creative ways to tackle challenges.
Everyone on the team needs to be entrepreneurial, wear many hats and cooperate in a highly collaborative environment that’s more startup than big company. We’ll need to take on problems spanning various domains, including Network Engineering, Hardware Design, Process Optimization, Process Documentation and work standardization.

The Tech Launch Engineer will leverage their leadership and technical capabilities to lead technical installations in the field, identify and manage risks, resolve issues and escalate where appropriate to drive new Amazon Retail store builds to successful completion. Through engagement with various internal teams, external vendors, and key suppliers, you will deliver in-store technology on time. You will play an active role in implementing business and functional deliverables in partnership with other technology leaders within the team.

You will help solve a variety of technical challenges and mentor other engineers. You will work with you peers to consistently raise the bar by reducing cost, complexity, and ambiguity out of the new store launch process. Additionally, you will play an active role in defining the installation processes for our technologies in partnership with other technical teams within the organization. You will support a variety of business initiatives in different regions. You will work on challenging, situations daily and given the size of this initiative, you’ll have the opportunity to work with multiple technical teams at Amazon in different locations. Be prepared to develop a solution and then scale it to meet the business needs. You should be comfortable with a degree of ambiguity that’s higher than most projects and relish the idea of solving problems that may have never existed.
basicQualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or relevant major and/or relevant industry experience
Ability to deliver projects with aggressive schedules.
Willingness and ability to travel 50-75% of the year domestically
Ability and willingness to multi-task and learn new technologies quickly
Experience in troubleshooting software systems
Experience with one or more of the following; networking, structured cabling / low voltage cabling, power infrastructure, infrastructure systems, or IT Support and Troubleshooting.
Must be able to work with arms above head
Must be able to work on a ladder
Must be able to lift up to 49 pounds with or without reasonable accommodation
preferredQualifications: Prior project or program management experience is a plus
Excellent written communication skills
Experience creating technical documentation or standard operating procedures for deployment, troubleshooting, or repair of IT equipment

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
Amazon Detective is an innovative, graph-based security analytics solution that helps security analysts investigate and triage security incidents. Detective combines security log data and threat detection events into a single view, providing graph visualizations and algorithms to answer analyst questions and allow them to drill down into detailed activity information.

You will be involved in a broad variety of back-end engineering functions — component-level design and implementation, system monitoring and operational excellence, DevOps processes, and more. Our service is a complex distributed system with data processing and ingest, an internal graph store and query engine, and significant user-facing features on the roadmap, providing many opportunities for ownership and delivery.

Work/Life Balance and On-Call Responsibility
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. We generally keep core hours from 10am to 4pm. Some of us start earlier and some of us stay later. After a learning period, you will join the on-call responsibilities, typically for one week every two months. We work hard to build fault tolerant systems to minimize how often we get paged. When we do get paged, we work together to resolve the root cause so that we don’t get paged for the same issue twice.

Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new team members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and Amazon tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior engineers truly enjoy coaching other engineers through one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews.

We care about your career growth. We try to assign projects and tasks based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
basicQualifications: BS or higher in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent experience
Demonstrated experience with distributed system or AWS services (either in a previous job or as part of school projects)
preferredQualifications: 2+ years experience in an object oriented languages, such as Java or C++
2+ years of AWS experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills and a highly collaborative attitude
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

title: Legal Recruiter
description:
At Amazon, Legal Recruiters are business consultants who bring operational excellence and creative ideas to multi faceted, competitive challenges. They are trusted with strategic responsibility and ownership for securing the company's most business-critical assets: outstanding employees. This role will be responsible for closing bar-raising, often passive, talent and creating programmatic approaches to hiring including a focus on building out engagement strategies with diverse populations in partnership with the designated client group(s).

As a Recruiter with the Legal Recruiting team, you are a critical partner to senior hiring leaders within the Legal department and are the helm of recruiting strategy execution. You will collaborate, deliver results, and earn trust with Legal hiring leaders at all levels, and partner effectively cross-functionally with HRBPs, Finance, Compensation Consultants, and many other key internal partner groups in a complex global enterprise.


The person in this role will:
· Contribute to definition and lead the execution of recruiting strategy in partnership with client group and teams of sourcing recruiters.
· Insist on high standards and ensure operational excellence, including delivering an on-brand candidate and hiring manager experience.
· Lead meetings with client groups to include overall hiring progress, prioritizing open positions across an organization(s), internal movement discussions, and consult in job scoping discussions as needed.
· Own the preparation and delivery of search status reports, leading status reviews on active searches and calibration discussions.
· Use data to confidently identify roadblocks and solutions in the recruiting process as well as influence key stakeholders around important decisions.
· Prepare, deliver, and negotiate offer packages, helping Amazon attract and secure top industry talent.
Just as Amazon has many unique businesses across retail, operations, and technology (software/hardware/services) and media/content verticals, our Legal Recruiting team hires for a complex breadth of Corporate Counsel and legal professional disciplines, from entry level to executive level, in retail, operations, intellectual property, real estate, cloud computing, business development and MandA, litigation, compliance, risk, labor and employment, and more.

Domain experience recruiting attorneys and legal professionals is strongly preferred but not required.


This position can be located in Seattle, WA or any USA Amazon Corporate office.
basicQualifications: 3+ years of progressive corporate and or search firm recruiting experience, including full life cycle recruitment.
Recruiting technology (CRM/ATS) experience with sourcing, tracking, and managing candidates.
Experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and client relationships.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent additional experience.
preferredQualifications: High aptitude for earning trust with clients, peers and candidates.
High-judgement decision making and experience working with confidential personnel information.
Experience recruiting senior talent in a corporate / in-house recruiting environment.
Experience recruiting passive talent for a corporate enterprise client in the tech industry.

Strong client focus and commitment to continuous improvement; ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships, must pursue conscious cost-containment efforts in recruiting, continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to delivering candidates to the customer.
Strong communication skills (including document writing), organizational, and negotiation skills.
Experience defining and executing recruiting strategy, including employer promotion in the marketplace, candidate management, diversity sourcing, and interview process management.
Resourceful, goal-oriented, and self-directed
Strong consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment, as a team leader and member.
Possess strong analytic skills with ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and our recruiting team.
Attorney recruitment experience, e.g. identifying, engaging, evaluating, and hiring candidates from both law firms and in-house legal departments.
International / multi-country recruiting experience.

title: Sr. RF Ground Systems Engineer
description:
Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.

Senior RF Ground Systems Engineer

Are you interested in being part of a fast moving, innovative ground systems team as a Senior RF Systems Engineer? The Kuiper Ground Systems team is developing an innovative, globally positioned, satellite gateway ground system consisting of satellite feeder link gateways and satellite telemetry, tracking, and control systems. Our ground gateways ensure high availability, ultra-efficient data rate transmissions to/from our satellites ensuring our customers are delighted by our service. Kuiper TTandC systems are used to communicate satellite command and control data in support of mission critical launch and early operations periods.


In this role you will:
· Become an owner and key member of the Ground Systems development team.
· Be a technical leader in the design, development, Integration, and test our systems from a radio frequency perspective.
· Collaborate with a highly skilled team comprised of systems engineers, hardware and software engineers, field engineers and IandT
· Guide key subsystem providers in development of antennas, modems, transceivers, and other products that comprise our ground system.
· Develop specifications, requirements, and designs, and perform analyses, prepare documentation, and conduct presentations for parabolic LEO tracking antenna systems
· Develop real time spectrum monitoring systems supporting diagnostic and continuous system performance improvements.
· Lead deployment and testing of ground systems in both laboratory and range environments, including developing test plans, and generating/approving test reports.
· Develop test plans to support the validation of the Ground Gateways to ensure they meet the technical, functional, performance, and business requirements
· Support development of spectrum monitoring, calibration, and operations systems for ground system and link performance monitoring.

Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
basicQualifications: Bachelor’s degree in electrical or RF engineering, physics, or related degree required, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 8 years of RF engineering experience in development and delivery of satellite ground gateway and/or TTandC antenna systems.
Systems Engineering or Design experience in an RF engineering role, including requirements management, RF integration and test, and verification and validation.
preferredQualifications: Master’s Degree in electrical or RF engineering, physics, or similar field
In-depth understanding of satellite communications link budgets.
Experience with the Mid-Earth and/or Low Earth Orbit satellite communications
RF Engineering and test experience in Ka-band as related to antenna systems and their associated ancillary equipment.
Experience with satellite communications spectrum monitoring systems and software
Ka and V band systems experience preferably with ground tracking antennas and systems
Experience with satellite modems and satellite ground system integration from RF to Network.
Experience in and capability to perform hands-on RF systems and component testing using state-of-art RF test and data collection equipment.
Ability to work collaboratively as a member of a highly motivated team who insists on the highest standards and deliver systems which delight customers.
Ka and V band systems experience preferably with ground tracking antennas and systems
General computer hardware and software proficiency.
Experience with Microsoft Office applications such as (Word, Excel, Project, and PowerPoint).
Experience supporting system engineering of ground systems development efforts including meeting cost, schedule, and performance goals.

title: Sr. SATCOM Ground Systems Integration and Test Engineer
description:
Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.
Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.

As a Sr. SATCOM Ground Systems Integration and Test Engineer, you will engage with an experienced cross-disciplinary team to test and validate innovative product solutions. You will work closely with colleagues throughout Project Kuiper’s inter-disciplinary team, and collaborate with key suppliers, in order to ensure our system exceeds customer expectations. You must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within a collaborative and fast-paced environment.

As a member of the Communications Ground Systems Team, you will be responsible for integration, verification and validation of our ground gateway terminals and systems including key supplier provided products. This includes testing, analyzing, and optimizing Ground Gateway Terminals from baseband systems to antenna.

In this role you will:
· Become an owner and key member of the Ground Systems development and implementation team.
· Provide Integration and Test leadership to both key gateway equipment suppliers and internal teams to ensure the performance of comprehensive Ground Systems integration, test, and validation efforts.
· Specify and document end-to-end Ground Systems integration and test plans to validate performance against ground system product requirements.
· Collaborate across the ground systems team and subsystem suppliers to develop optimized field integration and operational readiness test programs that enable project Kuiper’s innovative ground system.
· Engage with suppliers to evaluate their test and validation results versus expected product performance and provide proactive feedback on potential improvements.
· Work with product suppliers to develop and maintain successful product acceptance test programs
· Perform lab and field tests to integrate ground system baseband, transceiver, antenna and other component systems.
· Support development of operational monitoring and control systems use such to develop operational performance validation solutions.
· Prepare reports documenting test results, test coverage and other KPI metrics, and communicate issues effectively with developers and managers.

title: Software Systems Engineer
description:
Project Kuiper is an initiative to launch a constellation of Low Earth Orbit satellites that will provide low-latency, high-speed broadband connectivity to unserved and underserved communities around the world.


The Role:
Have you wanted an opportunity to lead the development of networked ground systems for an advanced satellite broadband telecom service? The Ground Systems team is developing globally located high data rate satellite communication terminals which are a critical part of our global ground network and which maintain critical connectivity from the ground to the complete Kuiper constellation.
This team is driving the development, deployment and long term operability of the Kuiper satellite Gateway and Telemetry Tracking, and Control terminals. These terminals include full motion parabolic antennas, localized networking including Software Defined Network interfaces, terminal control and monitoring systems, and embedded fault management systems. These systems form the communications backbone for out constellation and need to have mission-critical reliability, uptime, and performance.

In this role you will:
· Become am owner and key member of the Ground Systems development team with a focus on ground gateway networking and control systems.
· Work with our peer teams, suppliers, and customers to develop the terminal networking infrastructure, control structure, and interfaces to fulfill the mission needs.
· Design the gateway networking elements from a system perspective to meet the mission criteria and requirements.
· Provide leadership to ground gateway development performed by amazon teams and product suppliers from requirements through integration and test.
· Define and implement custom networking protocols, network security, quality of service, communications infrastructure and network management tools providing best-in-class network services for ground terminal systems.
· Define and automate the standard processes for design, implementation, and maintenance of network operations including incident resolution.
· Collaborate with teams and suppliers to develop software, networking and data interfaces and architectures and document such via interface control documentation and applications interfaces.
· Ensure delivered gateway systems meet Kuiper performance needs including availability, reliability, upgradeability, interoperability, and security requirements.
· Collaborate with your fellow Kuiper team members to form a strong foundation for a software and networking organization in Project Kuiper.

Export Control Requirement:
Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
basicQualifications: Bachelor’s degree in CS, CE, or related field, or equivalent work experience
5+ years delivering software in a production environment
Experience developing software and/or networking systems for satellite communications systems
preferredQualifications: Hands-on experience with designing and developing performance optimized and highly available networks
Experience with embedded systems
Hands-on experience with satellite communications and management software
Experience with Mid-Earth Orbit and Low-Earth Orbit satellite ground gateways and associated systems

title: Business Development Representative
description:
Technology is transforming our lives to the better – and Amazon Web Services (AWS) as the world`s leading cloud provider is a major enabler of this progress. But we are just getting started - and we are looking for Builders to come join us and leave their mark in this exciting period of time! If you are passionate about technology and are looking to advance your sales skills, join our team as a Business Development Representative (BDR)!

You will be the first point of contact to customers across Germany, Austria and Switzerland and guide them to build solutions on top of AWS that truly matter to them and their customers. You will directly interact with both new and existing customers, qualify their needs and closely work with Account Management, Solutions Architects, Marketing, Training and other teams to ensure the implementation of the solution.

Your tasks and responsibilities will include planning, executing and reporting on campaigns targeted at an accelerated adoption of cloud services focusing on prospecting.

You will continuously improve your communication, email writing, cold-calling and phone presence skills, and extend your technical knowledge to be able to speak on eye-level with both management and technical staff.

WHAT WE OFFER
• Comprehensive training curriculum, experiential training (job shadowing, role plays and simulations) as well as on-the-job training
• Possibility to achieve the AWS Associate Solutions Architect Certification within the first 6 months
• Mentoring by seasoned AWS professionals
• Modern offices in the Munich city center
• Free ticket for public transportation in Munich
• Amazon’s unique work culture: dynamic, hands-on, high-pace and a lot of fun!
• Regular after-work and networking events
• Competitive performance-oriented pay measured through key performance indicators (KPIs)
• Fast career progression within in a structured phased approach
basicQualifications: • 1+ year working experience in a relevant field (technology sales, customer service or similar customer facing roles) • Hands-on mentality: You should not be afraid to pick up the phone and call a prospect or customer • Fluent German and English both spoken and in writing • Excellent listening, verbal and written communication skills • Demonstrated ability to manage customer relationships • Experience managing numerous requests and time demands concurrently • BA/BS degree • Proficiency using MS Office, first experience using a CRM system • Interest in developing a technology sales career
preferredQualifications: • Self-starter, with proven professional success, who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, competitive and demanding environment • Experience navigating prospective accounts from and into a senior executive level to identify new customer opportunities in a focused market space • Skill at presenting, at a high level, a technical solution to prospects and customers relevant to their industry or target market • Record of success in an outbound sales or prospecting role in B2B environments, preferably in a solution-sales / technology-related environment • Skilled in prospecting techniques • Knowledge and understanding of existing and developing technologies as it relates to cloud computing; understand and identify opportunities for customers • Capable of understanding customer pain points, requirements and correlating potential business to value that can be provided by technical services • Proficiency in using CRM software, preferably Salesforce.com

title: Salesforce Administrator (Application Engineer)
description:
· Amazon Web Services (AWS) has been leading the world into the cloud computing era since its inception in 2006. The AWS Partner Network (APN) is the vital ecosystem we have created with our tens of thousands of consulting and technology partners, to promote AWS in every industry, every size of company, and every region of the world. APN offerings include validating partner qualifications in distinct areas, lead/opportunity sharing, training and certifications, marketing assistance, funding reimbursement, et al. The AWS Partner Systems team is responsible for external and internal supporting Partner Sales, the APN, and other elements driving the AWS partner ecosystem. We serve three groups of stakeholders: partners who work with us to sell AWS, customers who use AWS, and internal users responsible for driving AWS sales and adoption via partners.

We are looking for a talented and experienced Salesforce.com Administrator to facilitate our rapidly growing AWS Partner Network (APN). This individual will be a member of a team that is responsible for maintaining partner facing application built on Force.com as well as internal Salesforce application and it's integration with Amazon's home built services and applications.

As a key member of the APN engineering team, you will:
· Focus on strategic, tactical and technical initiatives involving Salesforce.com
· Provide administration support of Salesforce.com including but not limited to managing customization of objects, fields, record types, page layouts and validations, and dashboards for daily, weekly, monthly performance and reporting at individual, team, manager, and enterprise levels
· Proactively identify and implement operational and technical improvements and enhancements that drive productivity and improve customer/partner experience
· Handle multiple projects at once, be able to effectively prioritize initiatives, and effectively communicate with multiple stakeholders.

Key responsibilities:
· Manage Salesforce.com CRM including support requests and escalated administrative needs of users by providing prompt and complete resolution to technical challenges and business support issues.
· Hands on configuration of all new and existing Salesforce.com features including user management, roles/profiles, Permission Sets, custom objects, new page layouts, custom fields, formula fields, validations, workflows rules, email templates ,Process Builder, Flows, Lightning Pages, Custom Metadata Types, Custom Settings, Managed Packages.
· Focus on security, user efficiencies, solving business/customer issues, invent creative solutions, and ensure data accuracy across the Salesforce system.
· Partner with global business stakeholders to proactively identify, drive, and build improvements, enhancements, and system customizations that solve complex business problems.
· Understanding customer, internal sales and partner development team needs and translating them into robust business requirements for configuration and development in Salesforce CRM
· Roadmap development and prioritization in partnership with the global business stakeholders
· Participate and own change management process for the team. Drive communication efforts across relevant stakeholders
· Implement and optimize sandbox refresh strategy with minimum to no impact to sprint development and delivery
· Develop and train local and global admin resources.
basicQualifications: Bachelor’s Degree
5+ years Salesforce.com Admin experience and configuration of 300+ users
Experience using Salesforce data tools (Data Loader, Demand Tools, Workbench)
Experience with Classic, Lightning Reports and Dashboards creation, Process Automation, Security configuration.
Solid understanding and detailed experience of working with enterprise level Salesforce.com instance.
In-depth understanding of the capabilities and constraints of the Salesforce.com CRM application coupled with good understanding of standard business processes (Sales, Marketing, Operations, etc.)
Strong business analysis and functional understanding, including requirements gathering, creating/deploying solutions to end users.

Excellent verbal/written communication skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams. Ability to handle competing priorities in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
preferredQualifications: Certified Salesforce.com Administrator (ADM-201, ADM-211, ADM-301), Sales Cloud Consultant
Certified Salesforce.com Platform App Builder
Understanding of Apex/Visualforce
Experience in Process Automation, Security configuration, Data Model creation and Force.com Sites, Single Sign On.
Highly organized, detail oriented, and ability to work independently
Experience working in iterative projects, and with deployment strategies/processes (staging environment vs. production)
Strong understanding of Agile based development practices and Sprint planning strategies. Project management and/or business process management certification or equivalent experience
Experience working with global teams

title: Area Manager
description: As an Area Manager, you’ll have responsibility for the day to day management of a Delivery Station, providing leadership to Shift Managers, Operations Supervisors, Operations Assistants and Delivery Service Providers, managing external agency relationships and performance. This team will be entrepreneurial, wear many hats, and work in a highly collaborative environment that’s more start-up than big company. We’re in unchartered territory, doing what’s never been done. The adopted attitude is that no idea is a bad idea, and the best ideas are the ones that should be tested and tried. You will need to thrive and deliver results in an ambiguous, fast paced, dynamic environment. If you have a quality focused, customer obsessed industry background which carries with it experience of working in a fast paced, ever changing and ambiguous environment (such as manufacturing, the military or engineering for example) we'd love to hear from you. • Overseeing the operation that focuses on the delivery of Amazon orders direct to customers • Support your team of Shift Managers and the operations leadership team in daily management of the delivery station, including allocating labor, leading meetings, assigning job duties, and communicating with internal and external suppliers, including agency management representatives and their drivers. • Working to KPIs such as Delivery On Time, First Time Delivery Success and Enhancing Customer Service • Thinking analytically about project management with attention to detail, the ability to influence others and exceptional organisational skills. • Being obsessed by metrics and diving deep to find root causes quickly, to drive improvements • Finds practical and simple solutions to complex problems without sacrificing quality or core functionality • Ability to utilize exceptional problem-solving, and communication skills to influence business and technical audiences • Provide day-to-day support during the rollout/implementation of newer systems/processes and gather feedback • Map business requirements, understand business process, study and analyze workflows, design solutions. • Continuously utilize software and hardware tools to ensure normal day to day operations. Ensure associates have proper tools to perform the job and coordinate repair or replacement when needed. • Communicate daily metrics and report exceptions
basicQualifications: • Degree qualification or equivalent • Has knowledge and experience in direct-to-customer fulfilment operations as well as excellent technical, problem-solving, and communication skills • Experience defining projects, collecting requirements, designing process solutions • A forward thinker, with an ability to manage high levels of ambiguity and thrive on change. • Qualifications in Engineering, Operations, or related fields is a plus • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate effectively and build partnership relationships with both agency management representatives and their delivery providers • Experience with performance metrics and process improvement with demonstrable problem solving skills and analytical skills • Ability to work for different managers: we move managers around to meet business needs and as

our business grows and you must adapt to changes in management • Excellent customer service skills and interpersonal skills • Direct management experience for employees and their performance • Willingness to work flexible schedules/shifts/areas
preferredQualifications: About our rewards

We’ll expect you to go the extra mile, but we’ll also make sure you’re well rewarded. As well as a competitive salary and stock units, we offer a whole host of other benefits, including an employee discount. There are other, more intangible rewards too. Like our commitment to your development, a refreshing lack of hierarchy, the chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, plenty of team spirit and an informal atmosphere – suits and ties are few and far between. About us Operations make sure we live up to our promise: to deliver Earth’s biggest selection of products around the world come rain, hail or snow. We want to be a company where customers from every country will recognise, value and trust our products and our services. But getting the right product to the right place at the right time – every time – is no easy task. Explore our website – check out the stores, read some customer reviews and learn about our programmes. You can also visit our investor relations and PR sites to have a look at our last annual report and read recent announcements about partnerships and product launches. Yes, we’ll expect a lot of you and we’ll stretch you constantly with all sorts of challenges. But you’ll never feel like you’re going it alone. We’ll give you all the help you need to do the best job possible and encourage you to develop every day. Plus you’ll be part of a supportive team, working with colleagues, learning from them and collaborating to get the job not just done, but done brilliantly. And with all of us behind you, you’ll achieve more than you ever thought you Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Architect, Global Accounts
description:
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government.
Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Configuration management using CloudFormation, Chef and Puppet.
