Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.

Experience managing data center operations, including data assurance, monitoring, alerting and notifications.
Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges

Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (eg. security, privacy, SOX, HIPAA etc.)

description:
Do you like Alexa? Do you have a passion for cars? Do you love bleeding edge technology? title: Sr. Manager, Solution Architecture
description:
Do you have a passion for helping Public Sector customers to implement innovative IT solutions and be successful in their cloud adoption? Do you have a knack for helping customers to build a deep understanding of new cloud platforms and application architectures, through your consultative and leadership skills?

Above all, do you want to lead a dynamic team of Solutions Architects (SAs), bringing the latest in disruptive, cutting-edge cloud computing technologies to solve complex problems faced by public sector customers? Do you want to be a key part of a growing, world-class business development and sales team helping to establish Amazon Web Services (AWS) as the leading cloud technology platform in the public sector market worldwide?

Amazon Web Services is looking for a highly motivated Sr. Solutions Architect Manager to manage a team of SAs, supporting a sales and business development team that covers public sector in Chile, Argentina, Paraguay, Uruguay and Bolivia. You will be a hands-on leader, who leads by example. Your experience in building and managing high-performance teams will help accelerate our fast-growing business. This is an excellent opportunity to join AWS’s world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers and technical managers, while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and disruptive technology companies in the world today.

As a Sr. Solutions Architect Manager within AWS Public Sector, you will have the opportunity to help, shape and deliver the strategy to help customers succeed with their cloud adoption. Your responsibilities include leading and mentoring a team of highly talented SAs, helping them to set and surpass their own goals and to develop their talents and careers. This is a hands-on, detail-oriented, “roll-up your sleeves” environment and requires a passion for innovation, ability to deal with ambiguity as well as an ability to scale and influence broadly.

Role Responsibilities:
· Lead Solutions Architecture teams in driving revenue and market share for AWS through technical engagements
· Build and develop a robust team of Solutions Architects
· Work with customers to extend reach and drive adoption of AWS solutions
· Ensure customer satisfaction

title: Business Development Manager, AWS Marketplace for Public Sector
description:
The AWS Education, State and Local Government team is looking for a dedicated leader to join our team and drive the usage and adoption of AWS Marketplace solutions. AWS MP is a curated digital catalog customers can use to find, buy, deploy, and manage third-party software, data, and services that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses. To learn more about Marketplace, our categories and the services we support, please visit: https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace

You will help Education, State and Local Government, and government focused Independent Software Vendors (ISV) customers get access to much needed software solutions and consulting services. This role will own the strategy and execution plan to grow our EDU/SLG Marketplace business, and partner closely with sales and partner teams, as well a wide variety of other teams across AWS to support these customers. Identifying the right customers across verticals and different market segments, and then connecting them with the right software solution vendors and consulting partners will be key to success. This role will engage with state and local leaders, key software vendors and channel partners to drive customer adoption.

You are an accomplished leader with a strong background in selling technology, experienced at influencing innovation with technology and consulting partners, and with the presence to engage executive decision makers. Experience in marketing, training, and the Education or SLG domain are a strong plus. You will have strong business development, product management, strategic alliances, and entrepreneurial skills. They can demonstrate an ability to think strategically about new business models, solution selling, and show prior solution and program successes.
AWS customers are developing some of the most exciting and innovative new businesses, and partners are using cloud technologies from AWS such as AI and Machine Learning, IoT, security services, compute and storage to dramatically accelerate innovation.

Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Key Responsibilities
· Develop a short term and long term strategic AWS Marketplace plan for EDU, SLG, and relevant ISV customers. Prioritize specific customer segments and accounts to approach with a joint value proposition for using AWS Marketplace.
· Develop scalable and repeatable sales plays for Mid-market and SME customers
· Work with existing AWS business development and field organizations to engage with customers, and partners to execute joint go to market programs, owning the day-to-day interactions with existing and new customers to identify needs met through AWS Marketplace.

title: Manager, Demand Planning
description:
Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even image yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.

Job Overview
The Ops Robotics Supply Chain team is seeking a Demand Planning Manager to develop, manage, and maintain a comprehensive Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning (SIOP) process to support the Amazon Robotics network. The Ops Robotics Supply Chain Team manages a large portfolio of internal and contract manufactured product and is responsible for supporting a wide variety of global project initiatives that cross business teams and operations groups within Amazon. This role will work closely with our leadership team and stakeholders to develop performance metrics, drive best practices, and lead process and tool improvements that align with the strategic priorities of the team.

Primary Responsibilities
· Lead a team of demand planners to facilitate the translation of demand from various operational groups within Amazon’s business into an integrated monthly SIOP process.
· Actively support and foster a culture of inclusion.
· Collaborate with cross functional teams within Amazon and Amazon Robotics to understand demand forecast drivers.
· Assemble and analyze all data pertinent to creating the demand forecast. Analyze, communicate, and monitor the impacts of changes to deliver forecast needs to Supply Chain team partners, including Logistics, Commodity Management, and Purchasing.
· Provide input to developing demand planning strategies on existing products, new products and product phase-outs.
· Support finance partners with monthly inventory forecasting and reporting.
· Evolve and maintain standard operating procedures for demand planning processes and systems. Provide recommendations for operational improvements and innovate new metrics and KPIs to measure performance.
basicQualifications: Bachelor’s degree
8+ years’ experience in Supply Chain or Operations positions, 5+ years in Planning, Supply Chain and/or Operations.
Knowledge of SandOP and ERP/MRP Systems (Oracle/Demantra) or equivalent.
Experience in SandOP scenario planning and/or financial modeling.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment while prioritizing and managing multiple responsibilities.
Experience managing a team. Proven leadership skills with strong written and verbal communication skills to work internally and externally at all levels of management and with peers.
Excellent Microsoft Office skills, including strong working knowledge of Excel.
preferredQualifications: MBA
Experience working with Tableau analytics.
APICS or Six Sigma training with an understanding of Lean Manufacturing processes.
